title: Lowest Average Precipitation
description: In 2021, Egypt recorded an average precipitation of just 18.1 mm per year, one of the lowest globally, indicating arid conditions.

title: High Freshwater Withdrawal Rate
description: Egypt's annual freshwater withdrawals were 7750% of its internal resources in 2021, highlighting significant water resource challenges.

title: Minimal R&D Investment by Firms
description: Only 2% of firms in Egypt invested in R&D in 2020, reflecting a low emphasis on innovation and development.

title: Full Female Persistence in Primary Education
description: In 2020, 100% of female students in Egypt persisted to grade 5 and the last grade of primary education, showcasing strong educational retention.

title: High Tariff Rates on Primary Products
description: In 2019, Egypt applied a simple mean tariff rate of 99.4% on primary products, one of the highest globally, potentially affecting trade.

title: Low Price Level Ratio
description: In 2023, Egypt's price level ratio of PPP conversion factor to market exchange rate was 0.186, indicating a lower cost of living compared to other countries.

title: Minimal Losses from Theft and Vandalism
description: Only 0.2% of firms in Egypt reported losses due to theft and vandalism in 2020, suggesting a relatively secure business environment.

title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from Germany and Denmark
description: In 2022, Egypt experienced negative net bilateral aid flows from Germany and Denmark, totaling over $122 million, indicating a net outflow of resources.

title: Low Male Participation in Unpaid Domestic Work
description: In 2015, Egyptian males spent only 2.43% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, reflecting gender disparities in household responsibilities.
